The CEO's digital signature, hastily encrypted with a low exponent, leaked during a livestream. Can you retrieve the original message from the signature? Here it is: 0x171981a94da2aaca98014e61614be5abb39ff7ef6a426f03d9e2d685694a1a2ad2fc5a668f0fb681786c336ac4a2929425e255ec21dd193402ff2b8d402e8af6

Public Key (n, e): (8688179798686892964409744526425390884925591641125798487250833539064207484547916064615212125873635297792813793713090911732306083627538890706602166283157809, 3)

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{3qp4vd4v}
ciphertext: 0x171981a94da2aaca98014e61614be5abb39ff7ef6a426f03d9e2d685694a1a2ad2fc5a668f0fb681786c336ac4a2929425e255ec21dd193402ff2b8d402e8af6
cipher: RSA Low-Exponent Signature
hint: What happens when you cube small numbers? Remember e=3!
necessary_info: Public Key (n, e): (8688179798686892964409744526425390884925591641125798487250833539064207484547916064615212125873635297792813793713090911732306083627538890706602166283157809, 3)
subtype: rsa_sign_with_low_public_exponent
archetype: signature_schemes
